p:
White
23 proposed the plant stress hypothesis, initially stating that herbivore performance and population growth are enhanced on stressed plants, especially under water-deficit stress, due to an increase in phloem nitrogen. White
24 later restricted the plant stress hypothesis to senescence as opposed to flush feeders. On the other hand, the plant vigour hypothesis proposes that herbivores feed preferentially on vigorously growing plants
25 . Such plants may also become stressed, resulting in an increase in nutrients, and flush feeders could benefit from this nutritionally
24 .
